etymology.description: 木(木) (mù, "tree; wood") + 冊(冊) (cè, "a form made by lining up pieces of wood and binding them together") = a structure of bound wood pieces → fence
etymology.interpretation: The character 栅(柵) (zhà, "fence") logically combines the idea of wood with that of lined up and bound pieces, effectively representing a fence or palisade.

parts.english: a form made by lining up pieces of wood and binding them together

examples.chinese: 他在城边修建了栅(他在城邊修建了柵)，以保护村庄(以保護村莊)。
examples.pinyin: tā zài chéng biān xiū jiàn le zhà, yǐ bǎo hù cūn zhuāng.
examples.english: He built a fence on the edge of the city to protect the village.

examples.chinese: 庭院里的栅隔开了前后花园(庭院裡的柵隔開了前後花園)。
examples.pinyin: tíng yuàn lǐ de zhà gé kāi le qián hòu huā yuán.
examples.english: The fence in the courtyard separates the front and back gardens.
